00018 static inline
00019 uint16_t OCTEON_MAJOR_REV(octeon_device_t  *oct)
00020 {
00021     uint16_t  rev = (oct->rev_id & 0xC)>>2;
00022 
00023     return (rev == 0)?1:rev;
00024 }
00025 
00026 
00027 
00028 
00029 static inline
00030 uint16_t OCTEON_MINOR_REV(octeon_device_t  *oct)
00031 {
00032     return (oct->rev_id & 0x3);
00033 }

00039 #define   octeon_write_csr(oct_dev, reg_off, value) \
00040           OCTEON_WRITE32((uint8_t*)oct_dev->mmio[0].hw_addr + reg_off, value)
00041 
00042 #define   octeon_read_csr(oct_dev, reg_off)         \
00043           OCTEON_READ32((uint8_t*)oct_dev->mmio[0].hw_addr + reg_off)
00044 
00045 #define   octeon_write_csr64(oct_dev, reg_off, val64) \
00046           OCTEON_WRITE64((uint8_t*)oct_dev->mmio[0].hw_addr + reg_off, val64)
00047 
00048 #define   octeon_read_csr64(oct_dev, reg_off)         \
00049           OCTEON_READ64((uint8_t*)oct_dev->mmio[0].hw_addr + reg_off)

00061 /** Read windowed register.
00062  *  @param  oct   -  pointer to the Octeon device.
00063  *  @param  addr  -  Address of the register to read.
00064  * 
00065  *  This routine is called to read from the indirectly accessed
00066  *  Octeon registers that are visible through a PCI BAR0 mapped window
00067  *  register.
00068  *  @return  - 64 bit value read from the register.
00069  */
00070 
00071 static inline uint64_t
00072 OCTEON_PCI_WIN_READ(octeon_device_t *oct, uint64_t addr)
00073 {
00074     uint64_t           val64;
00075     volatile uint32_t  val32, addrhi;
00076 
00077     /* The windowed read happens when the LSB of the addr is written.
00078        So write MSB first */
00079     addrhi = (addr >> 32);
00080     if( (oct->chip_id == OCTEON_CN63XX) || 
00081         (oct->chip_id == OCTEON_CN66XX) ||
00082         (oct->chip_id == OCTEON_CN68XX) )
00083         addrhi |= 0x00060000;
00084     OCTEON_WRITE32(oct->reg_list.pci_win_rd_addr_hi, addrhi);
00085         
00086 
00087     /* Read back to preserve ordering of writes */
00088     val32 = OCTEON_READ32(oct->reg_list.pci_win_rd_addr_hi);
00089 
00090     OCTEON_WRITE32(oct->reg_list.pci_win_rd_addr_lo, addr & 0xffffffff);
00091     val32 = OCTEON_READ32(oct->reg_list.pci_win_rd_addr_lo);
00092 
00093     val64 = OCTEON_READ64(oct->reg_list.pci_win_rd_data);
00094 
00095     return val64;
00096 }
00097 
00098 
00099 
00100 
00101 /** Write windowed register.
00102  *  @param  oct  -  pointer to the Octeon device.
00103  *  @param  addr -  Address of the register to write
00104  *  @param  val  -  Value to write 
00105  * 
00106  *  This routine is called to write to the indirectly accessed
00107  *  Octeon registers that are visible through a PCI BAR0 mapped window
00108  *  register.
00109  *  @return   Nothing.
00110  */
00111 static inline void
00112 OCTEON_PCI_WIN_WRITE(octeon_device_t  *oct, uint64_t addr, uint64_t val)
00113 {
00114     volatile uint32_t  val32;
00115 
00116     OCTEON_WRITE64(oct->reg_list.pci_win_wr_addr, addr);
00117 
00118     /* The write happens when the LSB is written. So write MSB first. */
00119     OCTEON_WRITE32(oct->reg_list.pci_win_wr_data_hi, val >> 32);
00120     /* Read the MSB to ensure ordering of writes. */
00121     val32 = OCTEON_READ32(oct->reg_list.pci_win_wr_data_hi);
00122 
00123     OCTEON_WRITE32(oct->reg_list.pci_win_wr_data_lo, val & 0xffffffff);
00124 }

00132 #define   CN3XXX_DEVICE_IN_PCIX_MODE(oct_dev)       \
00133       (octeon_read_csr(oct_dev, PCI_CTL_STATUS_2) & PCI_CTL_STATUS_2_PCIX_MODE)
